resources.string: To check the withdrawal progress, tap withdrawal history.
For the security of your account, you need to bind your phone, email and Google verification before withdraw tokens.
I have saved the key. Next
The version is up to date
1. Copy the Google security key and use it in the Google Authenticator to create a dynamic code.
2. Please save this key. In case you lose your device, this key will allow you to recover your Google Authenticator account.

3. We are not responsible for safekeeping this key, nor will we be able to provide it again. If you lose it and cannot recover it, you will need to provide the relevant identification or evidence to unlink and reset account.
Get the latest dynamic code from your Google Authenticator
Or download Google Authenticator from app store

* Aibit officials will never ask you to transfer assets to an account or ask for a verification code under any circumstances.\nDo not participate in any illegal activities such as buying on behalf of others, money laundering and illegal fund-raising. Please beware of online fraud.
Your withdrawal request will be reviewed within 48 hours. Upon approval, Aibit will complete the transfer within a few minutes.
Your withdrawal request will be processed within 48 hours of the business day.

Tip: Please ensure that you choose the same network for the withdrawal and deposit and that the platform supports the network of your choice; otherwise, the withdrawal will be unsuccessful or returned
Please ensure the following information is correct
Why do I have to verify my personal ID?

KYC verification is necessary according to the local financial regulations or related policies. KYC verification helps to keep your account secure and prevent certain fraudulent behaviors. Your information will be kept strictly confidential.
Which countries and regions are not supported at the moment?
Due to compliance and regulatory requirements, the following countries and regions are currently not supported: %s

After adjustment, the margin occupied by the position will be reduced by %s. The reduced portion will remain in the position and can be transferred to the account balance
The payment rate exchanged between the long and short positions for the next funding. If the funding rate is positive, longs pay shorts. If negative, shorts pay longs.
Mark prices are used to calculate the unrealized PnL and the liquidation price of positions

Closing of long position by auto-deleveraging

%s Futures mark price reaches %s, and your %s position margin rate is less than 100%. Forced liquidation is triggered. The position %s will be fully taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price to reduce losses. Bankruptcy price is the mark price that makes the margin rate 100%.
Your %s position triggers ADL (Auto-deleveraging). %s in your positions is ADLed at the transaction price %s.
You have received a new user exclusive welcome pack
The futures new user trial fund can be used as trading margin and will be used first to cover position losses, transaction fee and funding fee.
%1$s %2$s Trial fund to be activated. Trade to activate

%1$s Perpetual futures mark price reaches %2$s, and your %3$s position margin rate is less than 100%. Forced liquidation is triggered. The position is taken over by the liquidation engine at the mark price %4$s.
Your %1$s position triggers ADL (Auto-deleveraging). %2$s in your positions is ADLed at the transaction price %3$s.

In a limit order, the user can set the order quantity and the maximum bid price or minimum ask price. \n When the market price meets the user’s expectations, the system executes at the best price within the limit price range.

Market orders allow users to place orders at the current best market price for fast closing. \n You can place a market order with your desired quantity or amount, but the execution quantity and price will depend on the actual transaction.
Confirm cancelation of the current order?
Your current buy order price is 5% higher than the best ask price. Are you sure you want to place your order?
Your current sell order price is less than 5% of the best bid price. Are you sure you want to place your order?
Long: Quantity × Close Price - Quantity × Entry Price\nShort: Quantity × Entry Price - Quantity × Close Price
Short position: Face value x number of contracts x (average opening price - average closing price)
Long position: Face value x number of contracts x (average closing price - average opening price)
No longer prompting. You can reset in 【Trading Settings】

The benchmark price is used to calculate the unrealized PnL and its rate of profit. Changing the benchmark price will not affect the margin level. The actual forced liquidation and auto-deleveraging triggers are subject to the mark price.
You can select unrealized PnL and its rate of profit to calculate benchmark price:

After switching the quantity unit, the unit used for entering order amounts, as well as the units displayed in the order book, open orders, and positions, will be updated accordingly.

Includes three mechanisms: Post-Only, FOK, and IOC
Your order will always execute as a maker. If it would execute as a taker, it will be automatically canceled.
The order will either be fully executed immediately or canceled entirely.
The order will execute as much as possible immediately, and any unfilled portion will be canceled.
Current number of positions. Submitting closing or reduce-only orders will reduce the positions available for closing
The higher the margin, the lower the risk. When the margin reaches 100%, the position will be liquidated

The real-time mark price of the futures. The mark price will be used to calculate the unrealized PnL and margin, which may deviate from the latest closing price of the futures to avoid price manipulation
If the mark price of the long/short positions is lower/higher than the liquidation price, your position will be liquidated
PnL on the closed portion of the current position

Do not enter personal contact information.

The stop-loss price must be greater than the mark price and less than the liquidation price
When the mark price reaches %1$s, the %2$s order is triggered, with an estimated PnL of %3$s and an estimated ROI of %4$s
Request to cancel lead trader status
Confirm to cancel lead trader status

1. To cancel the lead trader status, please first remove all your copy traders. \n2. After canceling the lead trader status, you will not be able to view the trader information such as the PnL to be settled, but it will not affect your actual profit sharing for this period. You can also cancel your lead trader status after the sharing settlement.
Each time the trader places an order, you will copy their trading direction at a fixed ratio. Quantity per copy trading order = number of positions opened by trader * fixed ratio.
Each time the trader places an order, you will copy their trading direction at a fixed limit. Total per copy trading = fixed limits.

Once you complete the setting, the positions you copy from this trader will be closed automatically based on your stop-loss setting. After opening the position, you can modify the stop-loss setting in position take-profit and stop-loss.

Once you complete the setting, the positions you copy from this trader will be closed automatically based on your take-profit setting. After opening the position, you can modify the take-profit setting in position take-profit and stop-loss.

The maximum margin of the position you copy from the trader for this contract. The position will not be opened when the sum of the margin required for the new position and the maintenance margin for your holdings exceeds the maximum copy trading amount
The estimated margin required to open a position.
Cross margin mode: All positions share the margin in the futures account to avoid forced liquidation. In the event of a forced liquidation, traders may lose all margin and positions.

Isolated margin mode: A certain amount of margin is allocated to each position. If the margin drops below the maintenance margin level, the position will be liquidated. In the isolated margin mode, you can adjust the margin for the position.
In one-way model, a contract can only have positions in one direction
In hedge mode, you can hold both long and short positions on the same futures simultaneously, hedging the risks in both directions
Exceeds the positions available for closing

I. When you trade in the futures market, if you suffer a loss due to market conditions, and your position margin is insufficient, please note that the exchange will impose a forced liquidation order on your positions and disclose the details of the liquidation in accordance with the system agreement. 
II. Please carefully read and comply with the rules of the Exchange. It is recommended that users understand the contract mechanism and operating principles, conduct proper risk control, and trade rationally within one’s financial ability. 
III. Under some extreme market conditions, you may struggle or be unable to close the open positions. For example, your PnL ranks first in terms of effective leveraged PnL across the futures market, and the insurance fund is not sufficient to cover the liquidation losses of the losing party. 
IV. Due to changes in local laws, regulations and policies, amendments to the trading rules of the Futures Exchange, and the introduction of emergency measures, the Exchange will disclose in advance if you may not continue to hold your open positions, but the platform will still settle margin and PnL! 
V. For reasons beyond the control of the Exchange, including force majeure factors such as earthquakes, floods, fires, or computer system and communication system failures, your orders fail to be partially or fully executed, and you may be liable to the losses. 
VI. Hedging is speculative and is subject to the risk of price fluctuations. Please understand the relevant mechanisms in advance. 
VII. Lending your account to someone else may jeopardize the safety of your contract margin. Please keep your personal account secure.

Position PnL is the total of profits and losses from closed positions. Position PnL is calculated from the entry price and closing price.
Realized profit includes all profits and losses from this position. Realized PnL = Position PnL - Fees + Funding fee.
Margin Balance = Wallet Balance + Unrealized P&L.

In a fast-moving market, it is not advised to set the SL trigger price close to the estimated liquidation price.

The estimated P&L is an approximate calculation of the profit or loss upon closing a position. The difference between trigger price and transaction price, as well as fees, can cause significant discrepancies between the estimated and actual values. Please use this as a reference only.\n\n Market TP & SL orders estimate the expected P&L based on the trigger price. Limit TP & SL orders estimate the expected P&L based on the limit price.
Take Profit/Stop Loss exceeds the maximum price

For security reasons, you can only upload a new profile picture up to 3 times per year. You may choose from our available avatars.

"1. You can only change your nickname once every 24 hours, so please choose carefully. \n2. When creating your nickname, please ensure it does not contain disrespectful words, Aibit official names (i.w. product names) and names from other trading platforms."
Nickname can be changed only once within 24hrs.
Note: Reversing a position is subject to market conditions and margin requirements, and therefore, we cannot guarantee 100% success.

The reverse function will close all current positions at market price and open an opposite position with the same mode, leverage, and quantity. If the margin is insufficient, a smaller reverse position will be opened based on the available margin. Additionally, the size of the reverse position will be limited to the maximum single market order quantity of the corresponding asset.

Estimated opening quantity for the reverse position. The actual opening quantity for the reverse position will depend on the available funds at the time of opening and may differ from the estimated opening quantity. Since opening a position is affected by market conditions and margin requirements, 100% successful opening cannot be guaranteed.
When order confirmation is enabled, a confirmation popup will appear each time an order is submitted
When reverse confirmation is enabled, a confirmation popup will appear each time a reverse order is submitted
You can disable the reverse confirmation popup in the "Trading Settings."

Calculate the mark price of the isolated margin position when the margin ratio based on the isolated margin balance is ≤100%. The estimated liquidation price of the isolated position is fixed.

Based on the current cross margin balance, calculate the mark price of the entire cross margin position when the margin ratio is ≤100%. The estimated liquidation price for cross margin positions will continuously change and is for reference only. The actual liquidation and position reduction for cross margin positions will be triggered when the margin ratio is ≤100%.

Please confirm if the receiving address requires you to fill in a Memo. Failing to fill it in or entering it incorrectly may result in asset loss. Other exchanges or wallets might refer to Memo as tag, digital ID, label, remark, etc.

The APR of fixed-term products is fixed after subscription. For tiered rates, APR is calculated based on your total subscription amount at the time of subscription. The reward starts accruing at 00:00 the day after subscription. Check the subscription page for specific interest and principal distribution times.
Redemption cannot be canceled, and all interest will be forfeited. After selecting early redemption, the assets will be returned to your chosen spot account within 24 hours.
Final Principal and Interest Distribution Time
This product is sold out, please choose another product.
This product has been delisted, please choose another product.
3.How is interest calculated and paid for locked earn products with daily interest settlement?
4.How is interest calculated and paid for locked earn products with maturity interest settlement?
Final APR is calculated based on the tiered interest rate rules, which include the current holding in this financial product:
Select the account for subscription funds

• Early Redemption Will Result in Loss of All Interest

After selecting early redemption, assets will be returned to your spot account %s
The assets in your spot wallet will be automatically subscribed to this flexible Earns product daily at %1$s.
The remaining 24-hour redeemable limit is insufficient; please re-enter.
• Redemption will not deduct any interest already earned.
The order will not be immediately filled as a Taker order in the market; otherwise, it will be canceled.
The assets in your spot wallet will be automatically subscribed to this flexible Earns product daily at %1$s (%2$s).

The APR for flexible savings may fluctuate based on market interest rate changes and will be subject to the APR displayed on the product page. Interest is calculated and credited to your flexible savings balance every hour, with the real-time annualized yield updated hourly.
Interest per hour = Flexible balance * APR / (365 * 24)

Interest from flexible savings is not credited to your spot account but is retained in your flexible savings balance for compounding. When additional subscriptions or redemptions are made, balance changes will trigger an additional settlement to ensure accurate interest calculation.

Once the redemption operation is completed, the assets in the flexible Earns product will be immediately returned to your spot wallet. Please note that each flexible Earns product has a daily redemption limit, and this limit may be adjusted.
When auto-subscribe is enabled, the fixed-term product will automatically renew into the same fixed-term product upon maturity. If not enabled, your assets will be redeemed upon maturity.
5.How is interest calculated and paid for flexible earn products?
When auto-subscribe is enabled, the fixed-term product will automatically renew into the same fixed-term product upon maturity. If not enabled, your assets will be redeemed upon maturity.

MAVOL means that the volume of a certain period is added upand averaged to form a smoother curve in the histogram of thevolume, i.e. the average volume line.

Applicable only to the partial position. In this mode, the TP/SL order quantity doesn\'t change with the position size. Multiple TP/SL orders can be configured.
For the entire position, TP/SL order quantity adjusts with position size changes. Only one TP or SL can be set per position. A market order will execute when the trigger price is reached.
The TP trigger price should be higher than %1$s.
The TP trigger price should be lower than %1$s.
The SL trigger price should be lower than %1$s.
The SL trigger price should be higher than %1$s.

When the <font color="%6$s">%1$s</font> price <font color="%6$s">%2$s%3$sUSDT</font>, will be triggered market price order, the quantity is the entire position, expected profit is <font color="%5$s">%4$sUSDT</font>
The TP trigger price must be > %1$s.
The TP trigger price must be < %1$s.
The SL trigger price must be < %1$s.
The SL trigger price must be > %1$s.
The SL trigger price for your long position is less than or equal to the estimated liquidation price, which may lead to liquidation before the SL is triggered. Please adjust the trigger price.
The SL trigger price for your short position is greater than or equal to the estimated liquidation price, which may result in liquidation before the SL is triggered. Please adjust the trigger price.
The SL trigger price for your short position is less than or equal to the estimated liquidation price, which may lead to liquidation before the SL is triggered. Please adjust the trigger price.
The SL trigger price for your long position is greater than or equal to the estimated liquidation price, which may result in liquidation before the SL is triggered. Please adjust the trigger price.
The price of a limit buy order must be less than or equal to (1 + Price Cap Ratio) × the current Mark Price of the futures.
Market Buy Order Price Cap Ratio
Trigger Price Cap Ratio for Conditional Orders
Trigger Price Floor Ratio for Conditional Orders
The price of a limit sell order must be greater than or equal to (1 - Price Floor Ratio) × the current Mark Price of the futures.
Under extreme market conditions, if the counterparty price of a market buy order reaches or exceeds (1 + Price Cap Ratio) × the current mark price, the entire order will be canceled.
Under extreme market conditions, if the counterparty price of a market sell order falls to or below (1 - Price Cap Ratio) × the current Mark Price, the entire order will be canceled.

If the trigger price is based on the Last Price, the trigger price for conditional orders (including TP/SL) must be less than or equal to Price Cap Ratio × Last Price. If the trigger price is based on the Mark Price, the trigger price for conditional orders (including TP/SL) must be less than or equal to Price Cap Ratio × Mark Price.

If the trigger price is based on the Last Price, the trigger price for conditional orders (including TP/SL) must be greater than or equal to Price Floor Ratio × Last Price. If the trigger price is based on the Mark Price, the trigger price for conditional orders (including TP/SL) must be greater than or equal to Price Floor Ratio × Mark Price.
The maximum number of conditional orders (including TP/SL) for this futures is limited to %1$s orders, independently managed across different futures.
Supports history records for the past 6 months only.
An existing better-priced order caused the %1$s order at %2$s %3$s %4$s to be automatically canceled.
This shows the available margin. Click to add margin.
Select order type, including Limit, Market, Conditional, and Advanced Limit orders.
Calculated based on UTC+0 time zone, with the formula:
Today\'s PNL = Funding PNL + Spot PNL + Futures PNL + Earn Profit
Today\'s PNL = Realized PNL + Net Funding Fee - Trading Fees + Unrealized PNL + Trial Bonus Profit
Today\'s PNL = Current Total Funding Asset Valuation - Total Funding Asset Valuation at 00:00 - Deposits + Withdrawals
Today\'s PNL = Current asset total - Today\'s initial assent total - Deposits + Withdrawals
Total Equity = Wallet Balance + Unrealized PNL
Profit are calculated based on the UTC+0 time zone, covering the total locked and flexible interest received in the Earn account from 00:00 (UTC+0) to the current time.
Wallet Balance is the actual balance of the futures account, excluding unrealized PNL, calculated as:
Wallet Balance = Total Deposits - Total Withdrawals + Total Realized PNL + Total Net Funding Fees - Total Fees
Total Unrealized PNL for USDT-M Futures calculated based on the mark price.
"*Except for Daily PNL, all other PNL metrics exclude unrealized PNL. Formula: Realized PNL + Net Funding Fees - Fees + Bonus Profit (Trial Bonus). "
"*All data on this page is calculated based on the UTC+0 time zone, and the dates shown in the charts are also in UTC+0 time zone. "
*PNL = Ending Total Funding Asset Valuation - Beginning Total Funding Asset Valuation - Net Deposits
"*PNL = Ending Total Spot Asset Valuation - Beginning Total Spot Asset Valuation - Net Deposits "
"Total PNL is calculated from the date the futures account was activated. The futures account activation date is %s. "
Market Cap = Circulating Supply × Latest Price
Current Circulating Supply of the Cryptocurrency
The Price at the Initial Public Offering (IPO) of the Cryptocurrency
The Maximum Supply of the Cryptocurrency in the Market
Maximum Supply Market Capitalization = Maximum Supply × Latest Price
Circulation Rate = Circulating Supply / Maximum Supply
Disclaimer: The data is provided by CoinGecko for reference purposes only. Aibit makes no guarantees regarding the accuracy, reliability, or applicability of the content.
*Real-time updates for today\'s PNL without delay; all other statistics are updated every 10 mins.

When the Mark Price of the %1$s futures reached %2$s, the margin ratio of your %1$s — %3$s — %4$s position dropped to %6$s or below, triggering liquidation. The position was fully taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price of %5$s to minimize losses.
Your %1$s — %2$s — %3$s position’s margin ratio has dropped to %4$s or below, triggering liquidation. The position was taken over by the liquidation engine at the bankruptcy price to minimize losses.
Note: The bankruptcy price is the mark price at which the margin ratio equals 0%.
The liquidation details only include the realized PNL from liquidation orders.

Maintenance Margin = Position Value × Maintenance Margin Rate
Position Value = Position Size (amount) × Mark Price
* In hedge mode, Position Size (amount) = Long Position Size (amount) + Short Position Size (amount)
Please be aware that in the event of abnormal price movements or extreme market conditions, Aibit will undertake additional protective measures, including but not limited to:
Includes the sum of your long and short positions.
Max leverage available within the notional value range.
Maintenance margin rate for positions within the notional value range.
